meanings.definition: To give up or surrender something
meanings.sent1: She had to relinquish her favorite toy to her little brother.
meanings.sent2: The soldier had to relinquish his weapon at the security checkpoint.
meanings.sent3: The magician had to relinquish his magic wand to the mischievous rabbit.
meanings.sent4: The CEO had to relinquish control of the company to the new management team.
meanings.sent5: The pirate had to relinquish his treasure map to the rival crew.

meanings.definition: To release or let go of something
meanings.sent1: He decided to relinquish his grip on the rope and let himself fall into the water.
meanings.sent2: The balloon slowly rose into the sky as the child relinquished it from his hand.
meanings.sent3: The cat reluctantly relinquished the mouse from its paws, allowing it to scurry away.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the day relinquished its hold on the world, giving way to the night.
meanings.sent5: The tree finally relinquished its last leaf, letting it float gently to the ground.
